trans-unit.source: (or prepend four spaces to each line), or place three tildes above and below your code with your code unindented:
trans-unit.target: 或在每行前加上四个空格),或者在你的代码上下两边各放三个斜线,你的代码不加标点。

trans-unit.source: * Every rule has an exception, the obvious one is for performance issues (in which case definitely use %timeit and possibly %prun), where you should generate (consider using np.random.seed so we have the exact same frame): df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(100000000, 10)). Saying that, "make this code fast for me" is not strictly on topic for the site...
trans-unit.target: * 每条规则都有一个例外，其中一个明显的问题是性能问题（ 在这种情况下，肯定使用％timeit，并且可能使用％prun ），您应该在其中生成（考虑使用np.random.seed，因此我们拥有完全相同的框架）： df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(100000000, 10)) 。 说“让我快速编写代码”并不是严格意义上的网站主题...

trans-unit.source: * I really do mean small, the vast majority of example DataFrames could be fewer than 6 rowscitation needed, and I bet I can do it in 5 rows. Can you reproduce the error with df = df.head(), if not fiddle around to see if you can make up a small DataFrame which exhibits the issue you are facing.
trans-unit.target: * 我确实的意思是很小 ，绝大多数示例DataFrames可能需要少于6行引用 ， 我敢打赌我可以在5行中完成。 您是否可以使用 df = df.head() 重现该错误，如果没有弄清楚 ，您是否可以组成一个小的DataFrame来展现您所面临的问题。

trans-unit.source: ** Sometimes this is the issue itself: they were strings.
trans-unit.target: ** 有时这本身就是问题：它们是字符串。

trans-unit.source: datetime indices or data
trans-unit.target: datetime 索引或数据

trans-unit.source: np.repeat and np.tile (columns d and e) are very useful for creating groups and indices in a very regular way. For 2 columns, this can be used to easily duplicate r's expand.grid() but is also more flexible in ability to provide a subset of all permutations. However, for 3 or more columns the syntax quickly becomes unwieldy.
trans-unit.target: np.repeat 和 np.tile （列 d 和 e ）对于以非常规则的方式创建组和索引非常有用。 对于2列，这可用于轻松复制r的 expand.grid() ,但在提供所有排列的子集的能力上也更加灵活。 但是，对于3列或更多列，语法很快变得笨拙。

trans-unit.source: Most data is proprietary we get that: Make up similar data and see if you can reproduce the problem (something small).
trans-unit.target: 我们得到的大多数数据都是专有的 ：组成相似的数据，看看是否可以重现问题（很小的问题）。

trans-unit.source: Aside: the answer here is to use df.groupby('A', as_index=False).sum().
trans-unit.target: 另外：答案是使用 df.groupby('A', as_index=False).sum() 。

trans-unit.source: Be specific about how you got the numbers (what are they)... double check they're correct.
trans-unit.target: 请具体说明您如何获得这些数字（它们是什么）...仔细检查它们是否正确。

trans-unit.source: But say what's incorrect: the A column is in the index rather than a column.
trans-unit.target: 但是，请说出不正确的地方：A列在索引中而不是列中。

trans-unit.source: Cut the intro, and just show the relevant DataFrames (or small versions of them) in the step which is causing you trouble.
trans-unit.target: 剪切介绍，仅在引起麻烦的步骤中显示相关的DataFrame（或它们的小版本）。

trans-unit.source: Essays are bad, it's easier with small examples.
trans-unit.target: 杂文不好，用小例子更容易。

trans-unit.source: Explain what the numbers come from: the 5 is sum of the B column for the rows where A is 1.
trans-unit.target: 解释数字的来源：5是A为1的行的B列之和。

trans-unit.source: Note: The ideas here are pretty generic for Stack Overflow, indeed questions.
trans-unit.target: 注意：这里的想法对于Stack Overflow非常通用，的确是个问题 。

trans-unit.target: 修改后的问题 ：

trans-unit.target: 如果需要，提供样品数据！！！

trans-unit.source: Please clearly state your question upfront. After taking the time to write your question and any sample code, try to read it and provide an 'Executive Summary' for your reader which summarizes the problem and clearly states the question.
trans-unit.target: 请事先明确说明您的问题。 花时间写完您的问题和任何示例代码后，请尝试阅读并为您的读者提供一个“执行摘要”，其中概述了问题并清楚地陈述了问题。

trans-unit.source: Qustion: How can I do [this]?
trans-unit.target: 问题：我该怎么做？

trans-unit.source: The Challenge One of the most challenging aspects of responding to SO questions is the time it takes to recreate the problem (including the data). Questions which don't have a clear way to reproduce the data are less likely to be answered. Given that you are taking the time to write a question and you have an issue that you'd like help with, you can easily help yourself by providing data that others can then use to help solve your problem.
trans-unit.target: 挑战回答SO问题的最大挑战之一是重新创建问题（包括数据）所花费的时间。 没有清晰的方法来再现数据的问题不太可能得到回答。 既然您花时间写问题，并且有一个需要帮助的问题，则可以通过提供其他人可以用来帮助解决问题的数据来轻松地帮助自己。

trans-unit.source: A kitchen sink example
trans-unit.target: 一个厨房水槽的例子

trans-unit.source: After importing numpy and pandas, be sure to provide a random seed if you want folks to be able to exactly reproduce your data and results.
trans-unit.target: 导入numpy和pandas后,如果你想让人们能够准确地复制你的数据和结果,一定要提供一个随机种子。

trans-unit.source: All my purest intentions are great and all, but I get that satisfaction if I answer 1 question or 30. What drives my choices for which questions to answer has a huge component of point maximization.
trans-unit.target: 我所有的最纯粹的意图都是美好的，但如果我回答1个问题或30个问题，我就会感到满意。 驱使我选择回答哪些问题的动机在于最大化分数。

trans-unit.source: And here is how to recreate my sample data: df = pd.DataFrame({'A': [...], 'B': [...], ...})
trans-unit.target: 以下是如何重新创建示例数据的方法： df = pd.DataFrame({'A': [...], 'B': [...], ...})

trans-unit.source: Anyway, I can probably go on, but I'll spare all of you who actually read this.
trans-unit.target: 总之,我大概可以继续说下去,但我还是饶了所有真正读过的人吧。

trans-unit.source: Anyways, have fun learning Python, NumPy and Pandas!
trans-unit.target: 总之,祝你学习Python、NumPy和Pandas的过程愉快!

trans-unit.source: But many example datasets need more complicated structure, e.g.:
trans-unit.target: 但很多实例数据集需要更复杂的结构,例如:。

trans-unit.source: Ctrl
trans-unit.target: Ctrl

trans-unit.source: Depending on the amount of data, sample code and error stacks provided, the reader needs to go a long way before understanding what the problem is. Try restating your question so that the question itself is on top, and then provide the necessary details.
trans-unit.target: 根据提供的数据量、示例代码和错误堆栈,读者需要走很远的路,才能明白问题所在。可以试着重述一下你的问题,让问题本身在上面,然后提供必要的细节。

trans-unit.source: Diary of an Answerer
trans-unit.target: 回答者的日记

trans-unit.source: Disclaimer: Writing a good question is HARD.
trans-unit.target: 声明:写一个好的问题是很难的。

trans-unit.source: Fake stock market data
trans-unit.target: 股票市场数据造假

trans-unit.source: For a more direct replacement for r's expand.grid() see the itertools solution in the pandas cookbook or the np.meshgrid solution shown here. Those will allow any number of dimensions.
trans-unit.target: 有关r的 expand.grid() 的更直接替代方法，请参见熊猫食谱中的 itertools 解决方案或此处显示的 np.meshgrid 解决方案。 这些将允许任何数量的尺寸。

trans-unit.source: For datasets that are hard to mock up using a few lines of code, is there an equivalent to R's dput() that allows you to generate copy-pasteable code to regenerate your datastructure?
trans-unit.target: 对于 dput() 几行代码来模拟的数据集，是否存在与R的dput（）等效的功能 ，该功能允许您生成可复制粘贴的代码来重新生成数据结构？

trans-unit.source: Having spent a decent amount of time watching both the r and pandas tags on SO, the impression that I get is that pandas questions are less likely to contain reproducible data. This is something that the R community has been pretty good about encouraging, and thanks to guides like this, newcomers are able to get some help on putting together these examples. People who are able to read these guides and come back with reproducible data will often have much better luck getting answers to their questions.
trans-unit.target: 在花了相当多的时间观看SO上的r和pandas标签之后，我得到的印象是， pandas 问题不太可能包含可重复的数据。 R社区一直很乐于鼓励这些事情，并且由于有了这样的指南，新手可以在整理这些示例时获得一些帮助。 能够阅读这些指南并获得可复制数据的人通常会很幸运地得到他们问题的答案。

trans-unit.source: Here is my version of dput - the standard R tool to produce reproducible reports - for Pandas DataFrames. It will probably fail for more complex frames, but it seems to do the job in simple cases:
trans-unit.target: 这是我的 dput 版本-用于生成Pandas DataFrame 的标准R工具，可生成可重复的报告。 对于更复杂的框架，它可能会失败，但是在简单情况下，它似乎可以完成任务：

trans-unit.source: Here is some minimal code that can reproduce my problem...
trans-unit.target: 以下是一些可以重现我的问题的最小代码......

trans-unit.source: Here's an example showing a variety of things you can do. All kinds of useful sample dataframes could be created from a subset of this:
trans-unit.target: 这里有一个例子,展示了你可以做的各种事情。各种有用的示例数据框都可以从这个子集中创建。

trans-unit.source: How can we create good reproducible examples for pandas questions? Simple dataframes can be put together, e.g.:
trans-unit.target: 我们如何为 pandas 问题创建良好的可复制示例？ 可以将简单的数据框放在一起，例如：

trans-unit.source: How do I fix it?
trans-unit.target: 怎么解决?

trans-unit.source: How to create sample datasets
trans-unit.target: 如何创建样本数据集

trans-unit.source: How to make good reproducible pandas examples
trans-unit.target: 如何制作好的可复制的大熊猫实例

trans-unit.source: However, when I try to do [this], I get the following problem...
trans-unit.target: 然而,当我试着做[这个]时,我得到以下问题.....

trans-unit.source: I have this data...
trans-unit.target: 我有这个数据.....

trans-unit.source: I like interesting problems.
trans-unit.target: 我喜欢有趣的问题。

trans-unit.source: I like points (I mentioned that above). But those points aren't really really my reputation. My real reputation is an amalgamation of what others on the site think of me. I strive to be fair and honest and I hope others can see that. What that means for an asker is, we remember the behaviors of askers. If you don't select answers and upvote good answers, I remember. If you behave in ways I don't like or in ways I do like, I remember. This also plays into which questions I'll answer.
trans-unit.target: 我喜欢积分(上面我提到了)。但这些分数并不是我真正的名声。我真正的名声是网站上其他人对我的评价的综合体。我努力做到公平、诚实,希望别人能看到这一点。这对于一个提问者的意义在于,我们记住了提问者的行为。如果你不选答案,不给好的答案投票,我记住了。如果你的行为方式是我不喜欢的,或者是我喜欢的方式,我也会记住。这也会影响到我会回答哪些问题。

trans-unit.source: I like points!
trans-unit.target: 我喜欢积分!

trans-unit.source: I want my result to look like this...
trans-unit.target: 我想让我的结果看起来像这样......

trans-unit.source: I want to do this...
trans-unit.target: 我想这样做.....

trans-unit.source: I'd like my final results to look like this...
trans-unit.target: 我希望我的最终结果是这样的......

trans-unit.source: I'll also spend time on interesting problems but that is few and far between and doesn't help an asker who needs a solution to a non-interesting question. Your best bet to get me to answer a question is to serve that question up on a platter ripe for me to answer it with as little effort as possible. If I'm looking at two questions and one has code I can copy paste to create all the variables I need... I'm taking that one! I'll come back to the other one if I have time, maybe.
trans-unit.target: 我也会花时间在有趣的问题上,但那是少之又少,对一个需要解决非有趣问题的提问者没有任何帮助。你要想让我回答一个问题,最好的办法就是把这个问题放在一个盘子里,让我用尽可能少的精力来回答。如果我在看两个问题,其中一个问题有代码,我可以复制粘贴来创建我需要的所有变量.....那道题我要了!如果我有时间的话,也许我会再来看另一个问题。

trans-unit.source: I'm motivated to answer questions for several reasons
trans-unit.target: 我之所以有动力去回答问题,有以下几个原因

trans-unit.source: I've tried to find solutions by doing [this] and [that].
trans-unit.target: 我曾试图通过做[这个]和[那个]来寻找解决方案。

trans-unit.source: If this was your actual data, you may just want to include the head and/or tail of the dataframe as follows (be sure to anonymize any sensitive data):
trans-unit.target: 如果这是你的实际数据,你可能只是想把数据框架的头部和尾部包括如下(确保对任何敏感数据进行匿名化)。

trans-unit.source: If your DataFrame has a multiindex, you must first reset before calling to_dict. You then need to recreate the index using set_index:
trans-unit.target: 如果您的DataFrame具有多索引，则必须在调用 to_dict 之前首先进行重置。 然后，您需要使用 set_index 重新创建索引：

trans-unit.source: If your code throws an error, do include the entire stack trace (this can be edited out later if it's too noisy). Show the line number (and the corresponding line of your code which it's raising against).
trans-unit.target: 如果你的代码抛出一个错误,请包含整个堆栈跟踪(如果太吵,可以在以后编辑出来)。显示行数(以及你的代码中相应的行数,它所对应的是你的代码的提升)。

trans-unit.source: In addition to taking subsets of the above code, you can further combine the techniques to do just about anything. For example, here's a short example that combines np.tile and date_range to create sample ticker data for 4 stocks covering the same dates:
trans-unit.target: 除了获取上述代码的子集之外，您还可以进一步结合这些技术来执行几乎所有操作。 例如，这是一个简短的示例，结合了 np.tile 和 date_range 为涵盖相同日期的4只股票创建样本报价数据：

trans-unit.source: In my efforts to give back, I've found this site to be an even more powerful resource than before. Answering questions is a learning experience for me and I like to learn. Read this answer and comment from another vet. This kind of interaction makes me happy.
trans-unit.target: 在回馈的过程中，我发现此站点是比以前更强大的资源。 回答问题对我来说是一种学习经历，我喜欢学习。 阅读此答案，并请其他兽医发表评论 。 这种互动使我感到高兴。

trans-unit.source: K
trans-unit.target: K

trans-unit.source: Main Advice
trans-unit.target: 主要建议

trans-unit.source: Make it easy for the people answering questions.
trans-unit.target: 让回答问题的人感到轻松。

trans-unit.source: Minimize that code. If my eyes glaze over as I look at the post, I'm on to the next question or getting back to whatever else I'm doing.
trans-unit.target: 尽量减少那个代码。如果我在看帖子的时候眼睛发呆了,我就会转到下一个问题,或者回到我正在做的其他事情上。

trans-unit.source: Motivations
trans-unit.target: Motivations

trans-unit.source: MultiIndex or Panel data
trans-unit.target: 多索引或面板数据

trans-unit.source: Multiple categorical variables (is there an equivalent to R's expand.grid() function, which produces all possible combinations of some given variables?)
trans-unit.target: 多个类别变量（是否具有R的 expand.grid() 函数的等效项，该函数产生某些给定变量的所有可能组合？）

trans-unit.source: My best advice for asking questions would be to play on the psychology of the people who answer questions. Being one of those people, I can give insight into why I answer certain questions and why I don't answer others.
trans-unit.target: 对于提问,我最好的建议是发挥回答问题的人的心理。作为这样的人之一,我可以从我回答某些问题的原因和不回答其他问题的原因中给出一些见解。

trans-unit.source: Now we have a sample dataset with 100 lines (25 dates per ticker), but we have only used 4 lines to do it, making it easy for everyone else to reproduce without copying and pasting 100 lines of code. You can then display subsets of the data if it helps to explain your question:
trans-unit.target: 现在我们有一个样本数据集,有100行(每个交易日有25个日期),但我们只用了4行来做,让大家不用复制粘贴100行代码就能轻松复制出来。然后你可以把数据的子集显示出来,如果对解释你的问题有帮助的话。

trans-unit.source: PLEASE show what you expect!!! I have to sit down and try things. I almost never know the answer to a question without trying some things out. If I don't see an example of what you're looking for, I might pass on the question because I don't feel like guessing.
trans-unit.target: 请出示你的期望值! 我必须坐下来试一试。我几乎从不知道一个问题的答案,不尝试一些东西,我几乎永远不会知道答案。如果我没有看到你要找的例子,我可能会因为不喜欢猜测而放弃这个问题。

trans-unit.source: Provide code that creates variables that are needed.
trans-unit.target: 提供创建需要的变量的代码。

trans-unit.source: See #3.
Some notes:
trans-unit.target: 一些说明:

trans-unit.source: Sometimes just the head or tail of the DataFrame is all that is needed. You can also use the methods proposed by @JohnE to create larger datasets that can be reproduced by others. Using his example to generate a 100 row DataFrame of stock prices:
trans-unit.target: 有时只需要DataFrame的头部或尾部就可以了。你也可以使用@JohnE提出的方法来创建更大的数据集,可以被其他人复制。用他的例子来生成一个100行的股票价格DataFrame。

trans-unit.source: Stackoverflow.com has been a tremendously valuable resource to me. I wanted to give back.
trans-unit.target: Stackoverflow.com 对我来说是一个非常宝贵的资源。我想回馈一下。

trans-unit.source: The groupby docs don't give any examples for this.
trans-unit.target: groupby文档没有为此提供任何示例。

trans-unit.source: The Bad:
trans-unit.target: 坏的人。

trans-unit.source: The Good:
trans-unit.target: 的好。

trans-unit.source: The Ugly:
trans-unit.target: 丑陋的人。

trans-unit.source: The docstring for sum simply states "Compute sum of group values"
trans-unit.target: 总和的 docstring 简单地说:"计算组值之和"

trans-unit.source: The instructions provided by @Andy for writing good Pandas questions are an excellent place to start. For more information, refer to how to ask and how to create Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable examples.
trans-unit.target: @Andy提供的有关编写熊猫问题的说明是一个很好的起点。 有关更多信息，请参阅如何提问以及如何创建最小，完整和可验证的示例 。

trans-unit.source: Think about what you're asking and be specific. We want to see what you've done because natural languages (English) are inexact and confusing. Code samples of what you've tried help resolve inconsistencies in a natural language description.
trans-unit.target: 想一想你的要求是什么,要具体化。我们想看看你做了什么,因为自然语言(英语)是不准确的,也很容易混淆。你所尝试的代码样本有助于解决自然语言描述中的不一致问题。

trans-unit.source: This is to mainly to expand on @AndyHayden's answer by providing examples of how you can create sample dataframes. Pandas and (especially) numpy give you a variety of tools for this such that you can generally create a reasonable facsimile of any real dataset with just a few lines of code.
trans-unit.target: 这主要是为了扩展@AndyHayden的回答,提供一些例子来说明如何创建数据帧的示例。Pandas和(特别是)numpy给你提供了各种工具,所以你一般只需要几行代码就可以创建一个合理的真实数据集的副本。

trans-unit.source: This produces:
trans-unit.target: 这就产生了:

trans-unit.source: When I've tried to do [this], I get the following problem...
trans-unit.target: 当我试着做[这个]时,我得到以下问题......

trans-unit.source: You can do quite a bit with np.random.choice. For example, in column g, we have a random selection of 6 dates from 2011. Additionally, by setting replace=False we can assure these dates are unique -- very handy if we want to use this as an index with unique values.
trans-unit.target: 您可以使用 np.random.choice 做很多事情 。 例如，在 g 列中，我们从2011年开始随机选择6个日期。此外，通过设置 replace=False ,我们可以确保这些日期是唯一的-如果我们想将其用作具有唯一值的索引，则非常方便。

trans-unit.source: You may also want to provide a description of the DataFrame (using only the relevant columns). This makes it easier for others to check the data types of each column and identify other common errors (e.g. dates as string vs. datetime64 vs. object):
trans-unit.target: 你可能还想提供一个DataFrame的描述(只使用相关列)。这可以让其他人更容易检查每个列的数据类型,并识别其他常见的错误(例如:日期为字符串与datetime64与对象)。

trans-unit.source: Your reputation is more than just your reputation.
trans-unit.target: 你的声誉不仅仅是你的声誉。

trans-unit.source: because du.dtypes is uint8 and pd.DataFrame(du.to_dict()).dtypes is int64.
trans-unit.target: 因为 du.dtypes 是 uint8 ,而 pd.DataFrame(du.to_dict()).dtypes 是 int64 。

trans-unit.source: do include small* example DataFrame, either as runnable code:
trans-unit.target: 确实包含了小*的DataFrame示例,或者作为可运行的代码。

trans-unit.source: do provide insight to what it is when giving the outcome you want:
trans-unit.target: 做提供的洞察力,它是什么时候给你想要的结果。

trans-unit.source: do show the code you've tried:
trans-unit.target: 确实显示您尝试过的代码 ：

trans-unit.source: do show you've done some research (search the docs, search StackOverflow), give a summary:
trans-unit.target: 确实表明您已经做过一些研究（ 搜索docs ， 搜索StackOverflow ），并给出摘要：

trans-unit.source: don't explain the situation vaguely in words, like you have a DataFrame which is "large", mention some of the column names in passing (be sure not to mention their dtypes). Try and go into lots of detail about something which is completely meaningless without seeing the actual context. Presumably no one is even going to read to the end of this paragraph.
trans-unit.target: 不要含糊地用语言解释,比如你有一个DataFrame是 "大 "的,顺便提到一些列名(一定不要提到它们的dtypes)。在没有看到实际的上下文的情况下,尝试着对一些完全没有意义的东西进行大量的详细说明。大概没有人会读到这一段的最后。

trans-unit.source: don't include 10+ (100+??) lines of data munging before getting to your actual question.
don't include a MultiIndex, which we can't copy and paste (see above), this is kind of a grievance with pandas default display but nonetheless annoying:
trans-unit.target: 不包含我们无法复制和粘贴的MultiIndex（请参见上文），这对熊猫的默认显示有点不满，但很烦人：

trans-unit.source: don't link to a csv we don't have access to (ideally don't link to an external source at all...)
trans-unit.target: 不要链接到我们无法访问的csv(最好不要链接到外部来源的csv

trans-unit.source: for du above, but it preserves column types. E.g., in the above test case,
trans-unit.target: 对于上述 du ，但保留列类型 。 例如，在上述测试案例中，

trans-unit.source: if it's relevant that you have Timestamp columns, e.g. you're resampling or something, then be explicit and apply pd.to_datetime to them for good measure**.
trans-unit.target: 如果您有“时间戳记”列是相关的，例如您正在重采样或进行其他操作，则应明确并对其应用 pd.to_datetime 以获得良好的效果**。

trans-unit.source: now,
trans-unit.target: now,

trans-unit.source: or make it "copy and pasteable" using pd.read_clipboard(sep='\s\s+'), you can format the text for Stack Overflow highlight and use
trans-unit.target: 或使用 pd.read_clipboard(sep='\s\s+') 将其设置为“复制并粘贴”，您可以设置文本格式以突出显示堆栈溢出并使用

trans-unit.source: test pd.read_clipboard(sep='\s\s+') yourself.
trans-unit.target: 自己测试 pd.read_clipboard(sep='\s\s+') 。

trans-unit.source: vs
trans-unit.target: vs

trans-unit.source: write out the outcome you desire (similarly to above)
trans-unit.target: 写出你想要的结果
